name: Clin T
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for carcinoid tumors of appendix.  Assign TX and behavior code /2 for in situ cases.

**Note 2:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Invasive tumor confined to:
        Lamina propria
        Mucosa, NOS (including intramucosal, NOS)
        Muscularis mucosae
        Muscularis propria 
        Submucosa (superficial invasion)

    Extension through wall, NOS
    Invasion through muscularis propria or muscularis, NOS
    Non-peritonealized pericolic tissues invaded
    Perimuscular tissue invaded
    Subserosal tissue/(sub)serosal fat invaded
    Transmural, NOS

    Extension to:
        Adjacent tissue(s), NOS
        Connective tissue

    Confined to appendix, NOS 
    Localized, NOS

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 or T4 as appropriate for contiguous extension from the site of origin. Discontinuous involvement is assigned in distant metastasis. 

**Note 4:**  Tumor that is adherent to other organs or structures, macroscopically, is classified T4b. However, if no tumor is present in the adhesion, microscopically, the classification should be pT1, pT2 or pT3.
rows: Tumor more than 4 cm or with extension to the ileum

Tumor perforates peritoneum or invades other adjacent
organs or structures, e.g.
* Abdominal wall
* Skeletal muscle

Adherent to other organs or structures clinically with no microscopic examination
Tumor found in adhesion(s) if microscopic examination performed

Adherent to other organs or structures, NOS
Adrenal (suprarenal) gland
Bladder
Diaphragm
Fistula to skin
Gallbladder
Greater omentum
Kidney
Liver
Other segment(s) of colon via serosa
Retroperitoneum (excluding fat)
Small intestine
Pelvic peritoneum
Ureter
Urethra
Vagina

Other contiguous extension

Stated as T4

In situ, intraepithelial,  noninvasive

(Adeno)carcinoma, noninvasive, in a polyp or adenoma

Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor 1 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 1 cm but not more than 2 cm

Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm OR 
With extension to the cecum
